title: Campaigner in hit and miss with facts about Nigeria’s stroke burden
subtitle: Stroke is the most common medical emergency in most hospitals in Nigeria, an expert claimed. Is this the case?
author: africacheck.org
vclaim:
• None The president of the Nigerian Stroke Organisation said stroke was the most common medical emergency in most hospitals in Nigeria and accounted for up to eight out of 10 neurological hospital admissions, with at least 100,000 cases every year.
• None There isn’t enough evidence to back up the claims that stroke is the most common medical emergency, or that it accounts for that many hospital admissions.
• None While Nigeria like many other countries is unprepared to treating stroke, accurate data would help improve the public debate.
